Amazon India transformed Mumbai into a beauty innovation hub today with the second edition of Amazon Beautyverse, presented by Maybelline in association with Bella Vita, Wishcare and Axis-Y. Held ahead of Prime Day 2025 (July 12–14), the invite-only event brought together over 600 beauty enthusiasts under one roof for workshops for an immersive beauty experience. The event featured Bollywood luminaries including Bhumi Pednekar, Neena Gupta, Kriti Sanon, and Sushant Divgikar, alongside Prime members, creators, and industry leaders. Attendees received an exclusive first look at new launches from leading beauty brands including Hyphen, CeraVe, Laneige, TFIT, Milani, Real Techniques, Nautica for Her, Lamel and more. "We are thrilled to introduce Amazon Beautyverse 2025, an exclusive event that reimagines beauty discovery for Prime members and Amazon influencers," said Siddharth Bhagat, Director - Amazon Beauty, India. "Beautyverse brings together a wide selection of beauty brands with expert-led workshops, interactive showcases, and beauty tech experiences. It's a curated platform designed to inspire and educate, while reinforcing Amazon Beauty's role as a destination for inclusive, trend-forward, and tech-enabled beauty discovery." Zahid Khan, Director - Central Shopping Experience, Amazon India, emphasized that at Amazon, community building is central to how we partner with creators. With Beautyverse, we are deepening these collaborations by bringing together creators, brands, and customers to celebrate and shape the future of beauty in India. Powered by tools like Amazon Creator Central, Creator University, and our AI-led Virtual Try-On, we are helping creators tell richer stories and enabling customers to discover and shop beauty more confidently. Actor Bhumi Pednekar, as part of the panel 'Beauty Beyond Boundaries: India's Global Beauty Movement' added, "Amazon Beautyverse is a powerful showcase of where online beauty is headed — to immersive trials and tech-driven diagnostics — every touchpoint felt designed to educate, inspire, and engage. I loved seeing everything from trending homegrown derma to k-beauty brands coming together with creators and customers in one space. It's exciting to see how Amazon is pushing boundaries and shaping what's next in beauty." The event's panel, 'Redefining Indian Beauty: Icons, Influencers & Inclusivity,' featured actor Neena Gupta, who shared, "I have seen beauty ideals shift dramatically over time. Amazon Beautyverse reflects a positive evolution — a space that celebrates self-expression and authenticity across generations. Today's consumer is more informed and conscious about their beauty choices, making this educational platform particularly relevant. It's wonderful to see how beauty has become more inclusive, with people discovering and embracing what works best for them personally, rather than following a one-size-fits-all approach." Amazon Beautyverse isn't just about beauty trends — it's about the people who shape them. As a creator, being part of this journey with Amazon means having a front-row seat to how beauty in India is becoming more expressive, inclusive, and community-driven.” – Yashi Tank, Creator. The event showcased premier beauty brands including Maybelline, Bella Vita, Wishcare, Hyphen, CeraVe, Pantene, L'Oreal Paris, Axis-Y, Tir Tir, Innisfree, Laneige, Makeup Revolution and many more. Visitors experienced exclusive Prime Day preview launches and participated in masterclasses featuring upcoming beauty tech innovations. As Prime Day approaches, Amazon Beautyverse stands as a reflection of Amazon's broader commitment to reshape beauty retail in India - blending technology, community, and creator-led storytelling to deliver a richer, more meaningful shopping experience. L-R: Siddharth Bhagat (Director, Amazon Beauty), Saurabh Srivastava (Vice President, Categories, Amazon India), Bhumi Pednekar (Actor), Zahid Khan (Director, Central Shopping Experience, Amazon India)

I'm looking for a drugstore shampoo (maybe both clarifying and daily), conditioner, mask, and leave in products for my fine wavy hair. I would say my hair is fine, but higher density. It is very dry and frizzy — I'm not sure of the porosity, I think I have a mixture since some pieces are bleached. I have a VERY sensitive scalp as well. I used the Pantene Volume Shampoo for a while, but that absolutely strips my scalp and causes itching and irritation. My waves are very frizzy and almost straight on the top whereas underneath they're more curly and defined, so I'm thinking I likely need more moisture? I'm also scared of protein overload since that has been such a huge think in social media nowadays, but I've been trying to use it every so often instead of just moisturizing products to have a balance. I thought lack of protein could also be why my curls aren't forming on the top layer since they're the most damaged. I also have hard water. I've trialed a lot of shampoos and conditioners and masks, here is what I have tried and things in my current routine below: Shampoos: -Cerave Hydrating Shampoo -Pantene Volume Shampoo (makes scalp itchy and dry) -Garnier Fructis Moisture Shampoo (use most days) -Loreal Hyaluronic Shampoo (purple bottle) -Dove Intensive Repair -Malibu Hard Water Wellness -Pantene Moisture Shampoo (weighs hair down) -Head and Shoulders Tea Tree 2-in-1 (use at least 1-2 times a week) Conditioners: -Cerave Hydrating Conditioner -Garnier Fructis Moisture Conditioner (daily conditioner) -Loreal Hyaluronic Conditioner -Dove Intensive Repair (sometimes mix with Garnier) -Pantene Moisture Conditioner -Loreal Bond Strength Conditioner -Pantene Miracle Rescue Conditioner (not the mask) Masks: -Olaplex No. 8 -Kerastase Symbiose Masque -Eva NYC Therapy Session Mask (made hair very brittle) -Elizavecca CER-100 Protein Treatment Other Products: -Loreal Bond Repair Treatment -Pantene 10-in-1 Leave in Conditioner (daily) -Garnier Fructis Hair Filler Hyaluronic Serum (daily, not hydrating enough) -Olaplex No. 9 -Moroccanoil Light Oil

First off, screw them and what they say. They really only have themselves to blame and be upset with because they didn't take the time or concern to learn about your hair needs and teach them to you. But guess what, you can learn on your own! Which you are taking the steps to do so now, you just need some guidance. Someone said something about Vaseline? Do not put that anywhere near your body. It clogs pores. First you should figure out what hair type and curl pattern you have. A Google search with some image comparisons would be a good start. I want to start a 3 step system and looked at a few websites. LUS and Prose have a quize on their website to help you figure out which curl pattern you have. Once you have that figured out you can do a little more research on that particular type. I used LUS but it has alcohol in it so it dried my hair out. Wouldn't recommend it. Pantene is not a good product. Stop using that. Find a good product that works for you. Make sure to look at ingredients that could dry your hair out. I started seeing a lady in my town that specializes in curly hair. I see her for "Crafted Curly Cut" it has transformed the look of my hair. The right cut really helps too. Do a Google search or a FB on one of those local "yard sale" community sites asking who specializes in curly hair in your area. My hair lady got me using what she uses. It's called Moroccanoil. It's in a bright blue bottle with a big gold M on front. It has really helped my hair. I don't need to wash as often and it doesn't weigh my hair down. There is a thing called training your hair. Washing less and less often so your hair doesn't get oily as often. Your family will likely complain but you could wear your hair in a man bun more often during this period, add some hair accessories, or hats while your in the transition period. Lots of dry shampoo!! (I only wash my hair about every 3 weeks) I also use dandruff shampoo every 3rd wash You may need to cut out conditioner, it could be weighing your hair down. Maybe use every other wash. If you don't have a good blow dryer, get one. Some coke with a diffuser. But aren't that big. You have a lot of hair like me. I purchased a LARGE diffuser that attached to my blow-dry Instead of the tshirt, get a microfiber head towel. The one that's shaped like a cone and have a button on the back. Not from dollar tree they are to small ( maybe my head just big lol) You need to start PLOPPING your hair. I will explain below... Get yourself a bonnet. Get a silk/satin pillowcase. A good bonnet from Amazon. Make sure it has silk or a satin lining. Sleep in the bonnet....

It looks like frizz to me. Do you sleep with your hair braided? A satin bonnet or silk pillow case may be very beneficial. It looks like you have a fine hair and a leave in would be quite beneficial at the very minimum. If you are looking for a drugstore leave in - I recommend the Pantene 10 in 1 spray or the L'Oréal 21 in 1 spray. I've also had incredible results pairing the leave ins the with Tressemme A list smoothing cream (a little goes a long way). I think your shampoo / conditioner mask routine is fine tbh. What products do you use? You could consider skip conditioner altogether and just use a mask in its place but it would have to be a lightweight mask like the Dove serum mask, Pantene Miracle Deep Repair Conditioner or the Elizavecca one on Amazon. You could also try incorporating some targeted treatments like the L'Oréal wonder waters (in place of conditioner) or L'Oréal glycolic gloss (post conditioner) or Amika's smooth over 1 min treatment- they really help smooth down frizz. Ultimately it will be a combination of a good conditioning routing and post shower products and protective styles while sleeping that can help calm this down.

Five Below is your one-stop shop for travel size toiletries. Not only do these items fit into even the most compact carry-on, they're all priced low enough to help shoppers save money. For You: 7 Little Luxuries To Buy at Five Below This July GOBankingRates reviewed Five Below's travel care department and pulled our top 12 affordable recommendations for your next flight. Price: $3 Need a sleeve of hand wipes for your trip? Pick up Wet Ones hand wipes for just $3. Each package includes 20 wipes with a wet lock seal to close and retain freshness when not in use. This comes out to paying about 15 cents per wipe. Check Out: 6 Costco Products That Have the Most Customer Complaints View Next: 21 Things To Buy at Dollar Tree This Summer If You Live on Social Security Price: $2 A trio of individually wrapped Kleenex tissues are a must for families on long flights to keep sneezes under control. At $2 per pack, this means Five Below shoppers pay only about 67 cents for each tissue sleeve. Try This: 3 Things Retirees Should Stop Buying To Save Money Amid Tariffs Price: $3 If there's not much space inside your carry-on, consider swapping out a regular-size or electric toothbrush with a folding travel toothbrush instead. These toothbrushes fold up easily to fit in toiletry bags. Hurry though: Just a few colors are still available to shop online. Price: $2 Along with buying a folding toothbrush, it's a good idea to pick up a travel-size Colgate toothpaste. This cheap mini toothpaste is extra handy for carry-on luggage in the event you get food stuck in your teeth during your flight and need to brush before arrival. Price: $2 No matter how long or short your flight is, it's always a good idea to keep a mini deodorant handy to freshen up. Secret deodorant is affordably priced and TSA checkpoint approved at 1.7 ounces. Trending Now: 11 Best New Groceries on Sale at Costco in July Price: $2 For the guys in your traveling party, it never hurts to have Old Spice deodorant handy. At 0.5 ounces, you'll have no trouble slipping one into your carry-on. Price: $2 Heading straight to the hotel after a long day of traveling and don't want to stop at a drugstore to grab toiletries? You're covered with Pantene Pro-V shampoo in a conveniently sized 3.38-ounce tube. Price: $5 What's nice about shopping for Vaseline mini lip tubs is they come in a value pack. Each package includes two mini tubs. Price: $5 Snooze away a long flight in a weighted eye mask. Only pink, green and blue styles are available to shop, so snag one while they're still in stock. Price: $4 You might stand outside for a bit to book rideshares once your flight arrives and, for those moments, you'll be glad you packed a travel size sunscreen. The Sun Bum brand is $4 and features SPF 30 to protect skin from harsh UV rays. Price: $3 Freshen up your face before arriving at your destination with Clarisse makeup remover towelettes. Each sleeve is filled with 30 towelettes designed for all skin types. That's Interesting: I'm a Shopping Expert — These 10 Items Are the Best Frugal Buys at Costco Price: $3 Depending where you shop, pill cases and organizers can cost upward of $7. Not at Five Below, where shoppers can pick up a bubble pill case for just $3 apiece. Store all of your prescriptions, vitamins and OTC meds in the pill case's six compartments and save a little extra room in your carry-on that would have otherwise been occupied by bottles and boxes. Amazon has discounted a haircare product that went viral on social media for its 'silky smooth' and 'waterproof' results by more than 40%. As part of the online marketplace's big sale event, Prime members can enjoy their favourite brands for a fraction of their usual cost until Friday, July 11. One deal with plenty of glowing reviews is on the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray, which promises to deliver "an invisible cloak with magical, moisture-resistant powers that lasts three days straight." It is described as "advanced anti-frizz formula leaves hair super glossy, glassy, ultra smooth." The Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray 200ml was £27, but thanks to Amazon's latest Prime Day Sale Event, Prime members can get it for 41% less, at £16. There is also a smaller bottle (50ml) for £12.50 if you want to test it out first. The haircare spray is also sulphate-free, gluten-free, and paraben-free, meaning it is suitable for vegans and those who prefer products without harsh chemicals. There are three different types to choose from, depending on your hair type. The Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray is, according to Amazon, best for straight, wavy, or curly hair that gets frizzy. The spray is designed to create "glassy-sleek, straight, frizz-free styles that last 3-4 shampoos." There is also the Extra Strength Dream Coat version, designed for people with "extremely dry, dehydrated hair or extremely curly/coily hair". Or, there's the Dream Coat for Curly Hair, which is best for wavy or curly hair. If you are after a similar spray to try yourself, there are many other alternatives to consider. You can get the Pantene 7-in-1 Weightless Hair Oil Mist with Biotin for £10 at Boots. VO5's Heat Protect Spray with Heat-Activated Complex is £4.99 at Superdrug. Amazon's 41% reduction on the spray is currently one of the cheapest deals available. The same bottle can be bought from Sephora, JustMyLook and LookFantastic for £20.25. It is slightly more on Very at £22, and at SpaceNK, it is full price at £27. Many Amazon customers say the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray effectively reduces frizz and keeps hair frizz-free for up to three days while making it 'silky smooth with a noticeable healthy shine'. The product has received mixed feedback about its functionality and value for money, though. Some say it works well and is worth the price, while others report it doesn't work on their hair and consider it expensive. Aine said: "Could not love this product more. If you're hair is any way frizzy or even a curly haired person who wears it straight like me. . EPIC." Lyndsay said: "I've repurchased this 3 times now, because the results are amazing." Louise said: "Incredible product! Does exactly hat it says! Makes your hair waterproof so that you don't get flyaway bits when the weather is humid or wet! If you want a salon look at home, invest in this product! The fact that you only need to use it about once a week, means it will last a while too!" An American shopper called Jen said: "I searched for something that would block humidity in Florida. Wow did this work!!!!" Westbury wrote: "I used this and blow dried using my brush on hot and it's FANTASTIC! my hair is silky smooth not frizzy the style lasts a couple of days." However, one shopper claimed: "Made my hair look like straw." Sally added: "Made my hair frizzier! It had the opposite effect on my hair than I wanted." Annabelle had an issue with her bottle, writing: "Just got a brand new bottle of this and I can't use it because the pump doesn't work." Another shared: "Hair does not stay frizz free or straight after use." Nonetheless, Lella said: "Woke up this morning and my hair is soft, smooth, shiny and incredibly frizz free. No heaviness, greasiness or crunchiness. I brushed my hair once this morning and it hasn't needed anything else all day." Katie put: "Amazing! I have very thick, frizzy hair, usually once I style it, it goes frizzy within a couple of hours. With this, the style holds and my hair looks and feels sleek and smooth for 2-3 days which has never happened before!"

The 'Supernatural' spray has been massively popular on social media for its 'silky smooth' and 'waterproof' results This article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more Amazon has slashed the price of a haircare sensation that's taken social media by storm for its 'silky smooth' and 'waterproof' effects, offering more than 40% off. During Amazon's massive sale event, Prime members can snag their beloved beauty brands at a steal until Friday, July 11. A standout bargain with heaps of positive feedback is the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray, which boasts "an invisible cloak with magical, moisture-resistant powers that lasts three days straight." It's touted as an "advanced anti-frizz formula leaves hair super glossy, glassy, ultra smooth." Originally priced at £27, the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray 200ml is now available to Prime members for 41% less, at just £16 during Amazon's latest Prime Day Sale Event. For those wanting to give it a test first, there's also a smaller 50ml bottle priced at £12.50. What does the Color Wow spray do? The haircare spray is sulphate-free, gluten-free, and paraben-free, making it a perfect pick for vegans and anyone keen on avoiding harsh chemicals, reports Glasgow Live. Shoppers have three different versions to choose from, tailored to their hair type. According to Amazon, the Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray is ideal for straight, wavy, or curly hair prone to frizz. The spray is crafted to deliver "glassy-sleek, straight, frizz-free styles that last 3-4 shampoos." What other brands are similar? The Extra Strength Dream Coat is ideal for those with "extremely dry, dehydrated hair or extremely curly/coily hair", while Dream Coat for Curly Hair caters to those with wavy or curly locks. For those seeking an alternative, the Pantene 7-in-1 Weightless Hair Oil Mist with Biotin is available at Boots for £10. You can also find VO5's Heat Protect Spray with Heat-Activated Complex at Superdrug for just £4.99. Amazon is currently offering a 41% discount on the spray, one of the best deals out there. The same product is up for grabs at Sephora, JustMyLook, and LookFantastic for £20.25, a bit pricier at Very for £22, and full price at SpaceNK at £27. What do shoppers say about the Color Wow spray? The Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray has been lauded by many Amazon shoppers for tackling frizz effectively and imparting 'silky smooth with a noticeable healthy shine' that lasts up to three days. However, reviews are mixed regarding its effectiveness and worth, with some celebrating its performance and others questioning its value due to unsatisfactory results on their hair. Aine couldn't praise the product enough, commenting: "Could not love this product more. If you're hair is any way frizzy or even a curly haired person who wears it straight like me. . EPIC." Equally impressed, Lyndsay said: "I've repurchased this 3 times now, because the results are amazing." Louise raved: "Incredible product! Does exactly hat it says! Makes your hair waterproof so that you don't get flyaway bits when the weather is humid or wet! If you want a salon look at home, invest in this product! The fact that you only need to use it about once a week, means it will last a while too!" Jen said: "I searched for something that would block humidity in Florida. Wow did this work!!!!" Westbury was thrilled, saying: "I used this and blow dried using my brush on hot and it's FANTASTIC! my hair is silky smooth not frizzy the style lasts a couple of days." Yet, one customer complained: "Made my hair look like straw." Sally noted her dissatisfaction: "Made my hair frizzier! It had the opposite effect on my hair than I wanted." Annabelle encountered a problem with the packaging, saying: "Just got a brand new bottle of this and I can't use it because the pump doesn't work." Another put: "Hair does not stay frizz free or straight after use." Nevertheless, Lella commented: "Woke up this morning and my hair is soft, smooth, shiny and incredibly frizz free. No heaviness, greasiness or crunchiness. I brushed my hair once this morning and it hasn't needed anything else all day." Desi said: "Let me start with the cliche 'I never review products' because I NEVER do. But as soon as I was done using this, I ran to my phone to review it lol. This stuff is INSANE... So far this is the best product I have ever used. Get it, you won't regret it!!" And added: "Amazing!...

SPR_COMBO[de]Die Haare sind matt und von der Sonnen geschädigt? Dieses neue Spray könnte jetzt Abhilfe schaffen und die Haare wieder glänzen lassen. Für bestimmte Links in diesem Artikel erhält BUNTE.de eine Provision vom Händler. Alle vermittlungsrelevanten Links sind mit einem Icon gekennzeichnet. Mehr Nicht nur unsere Haut, auch unser Haar sollten wir vor gefährlicher UV-Strahlung schützen. Denn durch zu viel Sonne können die Haare austrocknen, geschädigt werden sowie an Farbe und Glanz verlieren. Um all das zu verhindern, greifen viele jetzt zum aktuellen Amazon-Bestseller Nummer 1 – dem neuen Sunkiss Glow Haarspray von Pantene Pro-V. Doch was steckt hinter dem neuen Glanz-Spray? Pflegt und schützt: Das Sunkiss Glow Spray aus der Drogerie Neben Sonnencreme ist dieses neue Leave-in-Haarspray von Pantene Pro-V unser neues Must-have für den UV-Schutz. So bekommen unsere Haare wieder Glanz – trotz Sonne Der Name des Sunkiss Glow Haarsprays verrät es bereits: Unsere Haare sehen damit aus, als wären sie von der Sonne geküsst worden. originally appeared on Parade. Kelsea Ballerini is traveling back in time with her latest style switch-up. While partnering with Pantene in a new ad video, the country music songstress completely changed up her look to achieve the ultimate '50s-era vintage aesthetic—and her fans are simply "obsessed" with the timeless look. SIGN UP for Parade's Daily newsletter to get the latest pop culture news & celebrity interviews delivered right to your inbox In the new promotional video on Friday, July 11, the "Penthouse" singer replaced her long, blonde beach waves for a short and bouncy bob. The classic hairstyle made Ballerini look like a pin-up doll, with a style reminiscent of Marilyn Monroe's famous blonde hair. She was dressed in an ultra-short diner dress and a silky gold ascot, which she of course paired with some brown knee-high cowgirl boots. "Order up! Pantene Diner with a side of damage repair is coming to a city near you " the caption on the Instagram post read, while the video showed Ballerini, 31, walking through the retro-style diner. "I'll have what she's having " one fan gushed under the clip, while someone else quipped, "IM SAT. (at the diner)." "Okay SLAY Kelsea!" another one of the country star's fans wrote in the comments. Meanwhile, more users chimed in to call Ballerini "perfection" and "so gorgeous" in the new clip. Popular Country Songstress Completely Transforms Her Look with New Vintage-Inspired Hair first appeared on Parade on Jul 11, 2025

Yesterday, I woke up feeling under the weather, I made plans the day before to go to the salon to get my hair and nails done, but I ended up canceling all my appointments. I didn't know what was going on, but I felt weak, unmotivated, and down. My face was swollen, and my eye was hurting. Around 10, I forced myself out of bed. I got up, prayed, and took a hot shower, I wash my hair and do a small morning. I wasn't planning to go out of the house at all, but feeling the way I was feeling I told to myself you need to get some air, so I decided to go to the gym and made myself a nice healthy breakfast. I did some cardio and legs work and on my way home. I usually get in the sauna, but I wasn't in the mood for the heat. I stopped by the store to get some workout outfits because I gained a little weight, and none of my old ones fit anymore. After my eye surgery, I have been home eating and sleeping, so that's the result of that. I got home, took another nice hot shower, and I felt brand new. I made dinner and watched some christmas movies to cheer me up more. I was glad that I pushed myself a little harder. Some days are like that. Trust me, they will always come, but don't let it get to you. Get up and push back because most of the time , that's how sadness and depression started. I hope you're having a great morning. SPR_COMBO[it]Lamentarsi non basta. Ogni volta che accettiamo passivamente una decisione presa altrove – che sia un dazio, una guerra economica o un'ingiustizia globale – stiamo solo rimandando il momento della nostra dignità. Ma c'è una forma di attivismo che è alla portata di tutti, ogni giorno, in silenzio e con coraggio: scegliere cosa comprare e cosa rifiutare. Dal 1° agosto gli Stati Uniti, per voce di Donald Trump, hanno annunciato nuovi dazi pesanti contro l'Europa e altri paesi. Una mossa unilaterale, punitiva, che rafforza l'idea di un mondo diviso in blocchi dominati da interessi privati. Ma noi, persone normali, abbiamo un potere che sottovalutiamo: il potere del consumo consapevole. Basta con l'America nel carrello Non stiamo parlando di odio, ma di coerenza. Se veniamo attaccati economicamente, se l'Europa è trattata come colonia commerciale, perché dovremmo continuare ad arricchire le multinazionali americane con i nostri acquisti quotidiani? La lista dei marchi americani in Italia è lunga, e li troviamo in ogni supermercato: Coca‑Cola, Kellogg's, Oreo, Pringles Dash, Gillette, Oral‑B, Pampers Colgate, Palmolive, Ajax Swiffer, Mr. Muscle, Glade, Duracell Sono marchi radicati nelle nostre abitudini. Ma non sono insostituibili. E non finisce al supermercato Anche auto, telefoni, lavatrici, computer, TV sono spesso americani: Auto: Ford, Jeep, Tesla Elettrodomestici: Whirlpool, GE, KitchenAid Tecnologie: Apple, Microsoft, HP, Google Smartphone: iPhone, Pixel Servizi digitali: Amazon, Netflix, Meta Ognuno di questi acquisti sostiene un'economia che non ci rispetta. E non ci protegge. Esistono alternative Vuoi una bibita? Scegli un prodotto italiano. Vuoi un'auto? Preferisci europeo, giapponese o coreano. Hai bisogno di tecnologia? Asus, Samsung, Bosch sono opzioni solide e fuori dal circuito USA. Smetti di pensare che non serva a niente. Serve eccome. Se milioni di europei smettono di comprare americano, il messaggio arriva forte. Colpisce dove fa più male: nei profitti. Attivismo è anche questo Non servono bandiere né cortei. Serve coscienza. La prossima volta che prendi in mano una bottiglia, un dentifricio, un detersivo, un telefono, chiediti: sto nutrendo chi mi sta affamando? Boicottare non è odio. È autodifesa. È una forma di solidarietà silenziosa, potente, concreta. Ora tocca a te. Non subire. Reagisci. Comincia dal tuo carrello. Comincia da oggi. ADDENDUM – ELENCO RAGIONATO PER SETTORI DEI PRODOTTI E MARCHI AMERICANI DA BOICOTTARE IN ITALIA Boicottare significa scegliere. Significa usare la propria volontà come leva. Ecco una guida pratica per aiutarti a riconoscere, settore per settore, quali prodotti americani evitare e quali alternative preferire. L'elenco è stato costruito tenendo conto dei marchi con presenza diretta o dominante nel mercato italiano, nella grande distribuzione, nei marketplace e nei servizi digitali. —  ALIMENTARI E BEVANDE Marchi americani da evitare: Coca‑Cola Company → Coca‑Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Powerade, Honest Tea PepsiCo → Pepsi, 7Up, Gatorade, Tropicana, Lay's, Doritos Mondelez International → Oreo, Ritz, Tuc, Philadelphia (nonostante la produzione europea) Kellogg's / Kellanova → Corn Flakes, Rice Krispies, Pringles, Pop-Tarts Hershey's → cioccolato e snack americani Alternative italiane o europee: Bibite: San Benedetto, Lurisia, Galvanina, Spumador Snack: taralli, grissini, biscotti Gentilini, Loacker, Mulino Bianco Colazioni: muesli bio, cereali Alce Nero, Misura, Molino Nicoli —  IGIENE PERSONALE E PULIZIA CASA Marchi americani da evitare: Procter & Gamble → Dash, Ariel, Fairy, Swiffer, Gillette, Oral-B, Head & Shoulders, Pantene, Pampers Colgate-Palmolive → Colgate, Palmolive, Ajax, Sanex SC Johnson → Glade, Duck, Mr. Muscle, Raid, Off Kimberly-Clark → Huggies, Kleenex Alternative: Detergenza: Chanteclair, Winni's, Bio Presto, Nuncas, Verdevero Igiene personale: Spuma di Sciampagna, Neutro Roberts, Antica Erboristeria Cura casa: Emulsio, Felce Azzurra, prodotti Coop e Conad —  CURA DEL BAMBINO Marchi americani: Pampers (P&G), Huggies (Kimberly-Clark), Johnson's Baby (J&J) Alternative: Pannolini: Coop Crescendo, Naturaè, Nappynat (biodegradabili) Cosmesi: Weleda (EU), Fiocchi di Riso (IT) —  TECNOLOGIA, ELETTRONICA, INFORMATICA Marchi americani da evitare: Apple → iPhone, iPad, Mac Microsoft → Windows, Surface, Office, Xbox Google (Alphabet) → Pixel, Chrome, Android, Gmail, Drive, Maps Amazon → Echo, Fire, Kindle, Alexa HP, Dell, Nvidia, Intel → PC, laptop, GPU, CPU Alternative non americane: Smartphone: Fairphone (NL), Samsung (KR), Xiaomi (CN) Laptop: Asus, Acer (Taiwan), Dynabook (ex Toshiba) Cloud: pCloud (CH), Infomaniak (CH), IONOS (DE) —  GRANDI SPR_COMBO[es]Un shampoo barato y poco conocido, recomendado por la inteligencia artificial, podría ser mejor que Sedal o Pantene para cuidar tu cabello y eliminar la caspa. Aunque en el marcado abundan marcas reconocidas como Sedal, Pantene o Herbal Essences, la elección del shampoo ideal para cuidar tu cabello puede resultar complicada y costosa. Sin embargo, la inteligencia artificial (IA) ha sorprendido con una recomendación que rompe con lo tradicional y que, además, cuida tu bolsillo. Al preguntarle cuál es el shampoo más efectivo para mantener una melena suave, brillante y saludable, ChatGPT —una de las aplicaciones de IA más avanzadas— señaló un producto que no suele estar en el centro de atención pero que destaca por su calidad y bajo costo: el Equate 2 en 1 brillo y suavidad. ¿Por qué elegir Equate 2 en 1 brillo y suavidad? Este shampoo combina dos funciones en un solo producto: limpieza profunda y acondicionamiento. Su fórmula está diseñada para controlar el frizz desde la raíz hasta las puntas, proporcionando un acabado liso y con brillo natural, ideal para quienes buscan un cabello manejable y saludable. Además, este shampoo es especialmente útil para quienes sufren problemas de caspa, ya que ayuda a prevenir la descamación y el picor en el cuero cabelludo. Su espuma rica y cremosa deja una sensación fresca y limpia, controlando la grasa y la sequedad, factores comunes que afectan la salud capilar. La mejor marca de shampoo, según Chat GTP. Créditos: Especial ¿Cómo usarlo para mejores resultados? El uso recomendado de este shampoo es sencillo y se adapta a diferentes necesidades. Para un cuidado básico, bastará con aplicarlo dos veces por semana. Sin embargo, si buscas un mejor control de la caspa, se puede usar en cada baño sin problemas, pues su fórmula es suave y no reseca el cuero cabelludo. Este equilibrio entre eficacia y suavidad es una de las razones por las que la IA lo destacó como una opción superior, incluso frente a productos de marcas más famosas y con precios más elevados. TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Dormimundo, Sealy, América o Spring Air: las mejores marcas de colchones según Profeco Precio accesible y fácil de conseguir Uno de los puntos más atractivos de Equate 2 en 1 es su precio. Mientras muchos shampoos de marcas reconocidas pueden superar los 150 pesos por botella, este producto tiene un costo de solo 89 pesos por una presentación de 650 ml. Se puede adquirir en tiendas como Walmart, Bodega Aurrera y también en plataformas digitales como Amazon, lo que facilita su acceso a quienes buscan cuidar su cabello sin gastar demasiado.
